result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of a Child, Repeated Acts Causing Bodily Harm

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio Sarat-Hernandez

records.addlTxt:
3:11 PM Fred Svensson Interpreter appears. 
Defendant Antonio Sarat-Hernandez not in court.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii in court for Antonio Sarat-Hernandez.  Attorney Corinne L Frutiger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State moves for warrant - non appearance.
So Ordered "BODY ONLY"

Receipt Number 01776
Bond Posted as LCSO By Justiniano Alonso Gomez
Posted by Justiniano Alonso Gomez 122 Kennedy DR Darlington WI 53530
Fax Confirmation to LCSD - Cash Bond Set

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Victim 1 or  Child 1 listed in the criminal complaint.        
Defendant shall have supervised contact by Lafayette County Human Services with Child 2 listed in the criminal complaint.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with anyone under the age of 18 years old.

10:57 AM Fayme Interpreter appears. 
Defendant Antonio Sarat-Hernandez appeared by video from the Lafayette County Jail along with Jane Smith from Public Defender Office for intake purposes.  Attorney Corinne L Frutiger in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant acknowledges criminal complaint.
Court verbally reviews charges/penalties for the record.
Court finds probable cause for filing.
Court informs the defendant of their right to counsel.
Defendant is provided with PD phone number and petition for court appointed counsel. 
Defendant is provided with the Victims names.

Court Orders: $1,000.00 Cash Bond
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with Victim 1, Child 1 listed in the criminal complaint.        
Defendant shall have supervised contact by Lafayette County Human Services with Child 2 listed in the criminal complaint.
Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact with anyone under the age of 18 years old.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 15, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
